intro: Tetracera rhamnifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a distinctive waxy coating. The flowers are small and clustered, with a unique structure that aids in pollination by insects.
